example_html:
Southern-Style Black-Eyed Peas

These black-eyed peas are slow-simmered with smoky sausage, crisp bacon, and a deeply savory mix of aromatics and Creole seasonings for a rich, comforting, stew-like meal. While traditionally enjoyed in the Southern U.S. as a “good luck” meal on New Year’s Day, it’s a delicious, budget-friendly one-pot meal whenever you’re in need of a little bit of comfort. After a quick soak, the peas cook until tender in seasoned chicken stock, soaking up layers of smoky, herby flavor along the way. Hearty, comforting, and perfect for sharing, this classic dish is just as good on its own as it is alongside a starch of your choosing, like rice.

Mo Baker
Tasty Team
Updated on December 18, 2025
  • Share via facebook
  • Share via pinterest
  • Share via email
  • Share via sms
Total Time

4 hr 20 min

4 hr 20 min

Prep Time

10 minutes

10 min

Cook Time

4 hr 10 min

4 hr 10 min

Ingredients

for 6 servings

  • 1 lb dried black-eyed peas
  • 6 oz smoked sausage, cut into ½-inch cubes
  • 4 slices thick-cut bacon slices, cut into ½-inch slices
  • ½ yellow onion, finely chopped
  • 2 celery stalks, chopped
  • 6 garlic cloves, minced
  • 2 teaspoons creole seasoning
  • 1 teaspoon dried oregano
  • 1 teaspoon dried thyme
  • 1 dried bay leaf
  • 8 cups chicken stock
  • kosher salt, to taste
  • black pepper, to taste

Shop Ingredients

Build your cart with Tasty, then choose how you want to get your order from Walmart.

Preparation

  1. Rinse and drain the black-eyed peas. Place them in a large bowl, and add cold water to cover by about 2 inches. Let soak for 2–3 hours, until slightly softened. Drain, and set aside.
  2. Cook the sausage and bacon in a large, heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat, stirring often, until crisp, 8–10 minutes. Remove the meat from the pot, and set aside. Reserve the drippings in the pot.
  3. Add the onion and celery to the pot. Cook over medium heat, stirring often, until softened, 7–10 minutes. Stir in the garlic, and cook, stirring often, for about 2 minutes, or until fragrant. Stir in the Creole seasoning, oregano, thyme, and bay leaf. Pour in the chicken stock.
  4. Add the soaked black-eyed peas to the mixture in the pot. Bring to a simmer over high heat, then reduce the heat to low. Add the sausage and bacon to the mixture. Simmer, uncovered, until the black-eyed peas are tender, about 45 minutes, stirring the mixture every 5 minutes. Taste and season with salt and pepper as desired.
  5. Enjoy!
  6. Busy? Plan your meals for the week using our exclusive meal planner tool in the Tasty app. Download now and get organized.

  3. Add the onion and celery to the pot. Cook over medium heat, stirring often, until softened, 7–10 minutes. Stir in the garlic, and cook, stirring often, for about 2 minutes, or until fragrant. Stir in the Creole seasoning, oregano, thyme, and bay leaf. Pour in the chicken stock.
  4. Add the soaked black-eyed peas to the mixture in the pot. Bring to a simmer over high heat, then reduce the heat to low. Add the sausage and bacon to the mixture.   5. Enjoy!

example_html:
Southern-Style Black-Eyed Peas

These black-eyed peas are slow-simmered with smoky sausage, crisp bacon, and a deeply savory mix of aromatics and Creole seasonings for a rich, comforting, stew-like meal. While traditionally enjoyed in the Southern U.S. as a “good luck” meal on New Year’s Day, it’s a delicious, budget-friendly one-pot meal whenever you’re in need of a little bit of comfort. After a quick soak, the peas cook until tender in seasoned chicken stock, soaking up layers of smoky, herby flavor along the way. Hearty, comforting, and perfect for sharing, this classic dish is just as good on its own as it is alongside a starch of your choosing, like rice.

Mo Baker
Tasty Team
Updated on December 18, 2025
  • Share via facebook
  • Share via pinterest
  • Share via email
  • Share via sms
Total Time

4 hr 20 min

4 hr 20 min

Prep Time

10 minutes

10 min

Cook Time

4 hr 10 min

4 hr 10 min

Ingredients

for 6 servings

  • 1 lb dried black-eyed peas
  • 6 oz smoked sausage, cut into ½-inch cubes
  • 4 slices thick-cut bacon slices, cut into ½-inch slices
  • ½ yellow onion, finely chopped
  • 2 celery stalks, chopped
  • 6 garlic cloves, minced
  • 2 teaspoons creole seasoning
  • 1 teaspoon dried oregano
  • 1 teaspoon dried thyme
  • 1 dried bay leaf
  • 8 cups chicken stock
  • kosher salt, to taste
  • black pepper, to taste

Shop Ingredients

Build your cart with Tasty, then choose how you want to get your order from Walmart.

Preparation

  1. Rinse and drain the black-eyed peas. Place them in a large bowl, and add cold water to cover by about 2 inches. Let soak for 2–3 hours, until slightly softened. Drain, and set aside.
  2. Cook the sausage and bacon in a large, heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat, stirring often, until crisp, 8–10 minutes. Remove the meat from the pot, and set aside. Reserve the drippings in the pot.
  3. Add the onion and celery to the pot. Cook over medium heat, stirring often, until softened, 7–10 minutes. Stir in the garlic, and cook, stirring often, for about 2 minutes, or until fragrant. Stir in the Creole seasoning, oregano, thyme, and bay leaf. Pour in the chicken stock.
  4. Add the soaked black-eyed peas to the mixture in the pot. Bring to a simmer over high heat, then reduce the heat to low. Add the sausage and bacon to the mixture. Simmer, uncovered, until the black-eyed peas are tender, about 45 minutes, stirring the mixture every 5 minutes. Taste and season with salt and pepper as desired.
  5. Enjoy!
  6. Busy? Plan your meals for the week using our exclusive meal planner tool in the Tasty app. Download now and get organized.

example_html:
Liquid Convo | Make New Friends - Social Event for 22-35

Hosted by Eugene C.

Saturday, Dec 20 · 6:00 PM to 9:00 PM SST

Every 3rd Saturday of the month until December 31, 2025

Koyoi by Kanpai

1 Shenton Wy, #01-02, Singapore 068803 · Singapore

Details

Tired of the same old weekend routine? Ready to connect with awesome people and discover new passions? Liquid Convo is your social community designed for young adults (22-35) who are all about exploring life, forging genuine connections, and having a blast over some drinks! *While our events are geared towards those in the 22-35 age range, we welcome you even if you're slightly outside of it!

Stay in the loop and be the first to know about exclusive updates. Plus, connect with fellow enthusiasts and maybe even find a new drinking buddy! Join our Telegram community here:
https://t.me/liquid_convo
[https://www.instagram.com/liquidconvo/](Instagram)

### Event Details

Venue: Koyoi by Kanpai (1 Shenton Wy, #01-02, Singapore 068803)
Admission Fee:

  • Gents: $10 (payable by cash or Paynow at the door)
  • Ladies: FREE!

We have a zero-tolerance policy for solicitation, insurance, MLM, investment scams, or harassment. If anything makes you uncomfortable, please tell the organiser right away.

### Special Promotions for Our Guests

Koyoi is extending some special promotions just for Liquid Convo guests!

  • 15% Off Food: Enjoy 15% off the entire food menu when you attend our event.
  • Early Bird Special: Arrive between 6 PM and 7 PM to receive a free shot from Koyoi and a chance to win some great prizes, like a free bottle of alcohol, in a raffle!

### FAQs for Liquid Convo

Q: What is the admission fee for and what does it cover? A: We charge a small fee to help us create a great experience for everyone. The fee covers our operational costs, and ensure the night runs smoothly, and allows us to book the right venues for our group size.
Q: Will there be any food or drinks provided? A: No, food and drinks are not included with the admission fee. We have a fantastic venue with a wide selection of drinks and some food options available for purchase at the bar.
Q: This is an "unstructured" event. Does that mean nothing is happening? A: While we don't have a formal program or a rigid schedule, our hosts are there to help create a dynamic environment. They'll be on hand to facilitate conversations and help you start light icebreaker games if you and others are interested. The goal is to provide a relaxed, casual setting where you're in control of your night—whether you want to chat one-on-one or get a group game going.
Q: What if I'm shy or don't know anyone? A: We understand! Our friendly hosts are here to help. Just let an organizer know you'd like an introduction, and we'll happily connect you with a few people to get the conversation started.

More questions? Telegram me at @assortedbacon

Stay in the loop and be the first to know about exclusive updates. Plus, connect with fellow enthusiasts and maybe even find a new drinking buddy! Join our Telegram community here:
https://t.me/liquid_convo
[https://www.instagram.com/liquidconvo/](Instagram)

### Event Details

Venue: Koyoi by Kanpai (1 Shenton Wy, #01-02, Singapore 068803)

  • Gents: $10 (payable by cash or Paynow at the door)

### Special Promotions for Our Guests

Koyoi is extending some special promotions just for Liquid Convo guests!

### FAQs for Liquid Convo

Q: Will there be any food or drinks provided? A: No, food and drinks are not included with the admission fee. We have a fantastic venue with a wide selection of drinks and some food options available for purchase at the bar.
Q: This is an "unstructured" event. Does that mean nothing is happening? A: While we don't have a formal program or a rigid schedule, our hosts are there to help create a dynamic environment. They'll be on hand to facilitate conversations and help you start light icebreaker games if you and others are interested. The goal is to provide a relaxed, casual setting where you're in control of your night—whether you want to chat one-on-one or get a group game going.
Q: What if I'm shy or don't know anyone? A: We understand! Our friendly hosts are here to help. Just let an organizer know you'd like an introduction, and we'll happily connect you with a few people to get the conversation started.

More questions? Telegram me at @assortedbacon

Pork Chops with Apples, Onions, and Sweet Potatoes

4.2
(476)
394 Reviews
29 Photos

This is so easy, so good, and so versatile! I've used pork chops with and without bones, pork loin, and pork roast. You can sprinkle the brown sugar, salt, and pepper on the different layers or all at the end, as mentioned in the recipe. Play around with the brown sugar and spices to your taste.

Submitted by ashbeth
Updated on December 3, 2024
Prep Time:
15 mins
Cook Time:
1 hr
Total Time:
1 hr 15 mins
Servings:
4
Yield:
4 servings
Keep Screen Awake

Ingredients

Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it.

This recipe was developed at its original yield. Ingredient amounts are automatically adjusted, but cooking times and steps remain unchanged. Note that not all recipes scale perfectly. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings

  • 4 pork chops

  • salt and pepper to taste

  • 2 onions, sliced into rings

  • 2 sweet potatoes, sliced

  • 2 apples - peeled, cored, and sliced into rings

  • 3 tablespoons brown sugar

  • 2 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper

  • 1 teaspoon salt

Directions

  1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

  2. Season pork chops with salt and pepper to taste, and arrange in a medium oven safe skillet. Top pork chops with onions, sweet potatoes, and apples. Sprinkle with brown sugar. Season with 2 teaspoons pepper and 1 teaspoon salt.

  3. Cover, and bake 1 hour in the preheated oven, until sweet potatoes are tender and pork chops have reached an internal temperature of 145 degrees F (63 degrees C).

example_html:
M&A Tech Engineer

Paris / London
Engineering & Infra /
Full-time /
On-site
Apply for this job
About Mistral 

At Mistral AI, we believe in the power of AI to simplify tasks, save time, and enhance learning and creativity. Our technology is designed to integrate seamlessly into daily working life.

We democratize AI through high-performance, optimized, open-source and cutting-edge models, products and solutions. Our comprehensive AI platform is designed to meet enterprise needs, whether on-premises or in cloud environments. Our offerings include le Chat, the AI assistant for life and work.

We are a dynamic, collaborative team passionate about AI and its potential to transform society.
Our diverse workforce thrives in competitive environments and is committed to driving innovation. Our teams are distributed between France, USA, UK, Germany and Singapore. We are creative, low-ego and team-spirited.

Join us to be part of a pioneering company shaping the future of AI. Together, we can make a meaningful impact. See more about our culture on https://mistral.ai/careers.

Role Summary : M&A Tech Engineer

As M&A Tech Engineer, you will be at the forefront of our growth strategy, driving innovation and expansion through strategic acquisitions. This role combines a strong technical background with strategic vision. 

You will be responsible for identifying and evaluating M&A opportunities that align with our technical and business goals, impacting Mistral’s ability to innovate and expand our market presence. You will collaborate with Product, Engineering, Legal, and Finance teams to assess potential acquisition targets from a technical perspective. 

By executing on high-potential acquisition opportunities, you will help us enhance our technical capabilities, expand our product offerings, and strengthen our position in the market. Your work will be instrumental in shaping the future of Mistral AI and driving our mission to democratize AI.

What You Will Do

Identify and Evaluate Opportunities:
• Conduct market research in the AI ecosystem to find relevant target companies within our priority acquisition areas
• Evaluate the technical potential of targets’ products and technology as well as their fit with Mistral’s offering

Conduct Technical Due Diligence:
• Evaluate target’s technology by testing their products and reviewing codebases, architectures and tech stack.
• Assess target’s technical team members and structure.
• Understand target’s product and engineering roadmap and its scalability
• Work with our engineering team to assess technical synergies and integration path.

Collaborate with Engineering:
• Partner with Tech leads to define and adjust our strategic acquisition categories and criteria
• Pitch the target post your first technical evaluation to Product and Engineering leads
• Provide technical insights to inform investment decisions and integration planning.

Leadership Collaboration:
• Work with our CEO, CTO, and other senior leaders to align M&A strategy with business objectives.
• Provide learnings and trends based on M&A exploration of the AI start-up landscape


Who You Are

• You hold a degree in a relevant scientific field (e.g., Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, etc.)
• You have deep understanding of concepts and algorithms underlying machine learning and LLMs
• You are knowledgeable in AI or machine learning product implementation with APIs, back-end and front-end interfaces.
• You can read Python code and are familiar with agents framework such as Langchain, vector DBs
• You are curious and knowledgeable about the AI ecosystem and discovering start-ups proposing innovative solutions to tough AI issues
• You are curious about M&A, venture capital, or related fields and willing to transfer your technicals skills into sourcing, evaluating, and executing high-impact deals
• Your strategic mindset allows you to identify opportunities that align with our business objectives and technical vision


Benefits

France

💰 Competitive cash salary and equity
🥕 Daily lunch vouchers : Swile meal vouchers with 10,83€ per worked day, incl 60% offered by company
🥎 Sport : Enjoy discounted access to gyms and fitness studios through our Wellpass partnership
🚴 Transportation : Monthly contribution to a mobility pass via Betterway
🧑‍⚕️ Health : Full health insurance for you and your family
🍼 Parental : Generous parental leave policy
🌎 Visa sponsorship
🤝 Coaching: we offer BetterUp coaching on a voluntary basis
We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.
Apply for this job

We democratize AI through high-performance, optimized, open-source and cutting-edge models, products and solutions. Our comprehensive AI platform is designed to meet enterprise needs, whether on-premises or in cloud environments. Our offerings include le Chat, the AI assistant for life and work.

We are a dynamic, collaborative team passionate about AI and its potential to transform society.
Our diverse workforce thrives in competitive environments and is committed to driving innovation. Our teams are distributed between France, USA, UK, Germany and Singapore. We are creative, low-ego and team-spirited.

Join us to be part of a pioneering company shaping the future of AI. Together, we can make a meaningful impact. See more about our culture on https://mistral.ai/careers.

Role Summary : M&A Tech Engineer

As M&A Tech Engineer, you will be at the forefront of our growth strategy, driving innovation and expansion through strategic acquisitions. This role combines a strong technical background with strategic vision. 

You will be responsible for identifying and evaluating M&A opportunities that align with our technical and business goals, impacting Mistral’s ability to innovate and expand our market presence. You will collaborate with Product, Engineering, Legal, and Finance teams to assess potential acquisition targets from a technical perspective. 

By executing on high-potential acquisition opportunities, you will help us enhance our technical capabilities, expand our product offerings, and strengthen our position in the market. Your work will be instrumental in shaping the future of Mistral AI and driving our mission to democratize AI.

What You Will Do

Identify and Evaluate Opportunities:
• Conduct market research in the AI ecosystem to find relevant target companies within our priority acquisition areas
• Evaluate the technical potential of targets’ products and technology as well as their fit with Mistral’s offering

Conduct Technical Due Diligence:
• Evaluate target’s technology by testing their products and reviewing codebases, architectures and tech stack.
• Assess target’s technical team members and structure.
• Understand target’s product and engineering roadmap and its scalability
• Work with our engineering team to assess technical synergies and integration path.

Collaborate with Engineering:
• Partner with Tech leads to define and adjust our strategic acquisition categories and criteria
• Pitch the target post your first technical evaluation to Product and Engineering leads
• Provide technical insights to inform investment decisions and integration planning.

Leadership Collaboration:
• Work with our CEO, CTO, and other senior leaders to align M&A strategy with business objectives.
• Provide learnings and trends based on M&A exploration of the AI start-up landscape


Who You Are

• You hold a degree in a relevant scientific field (e.g., Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, etc.)
• You have deep understanding of concepts and algorithms underlying machine learning and LLMs
• You are knowledgeable in AI or machine learning product implementation with APIs, back-end and front-end interfaces.
• You can read Python code and are familiar with agents framework such as Langchain, vector DBs
• You are curious and knowledgeable about the AI ecosystem and discovering start-ups proposing innovative solutions to tough AI issues
• You are curious about M&A, venture capital, or related fields and willing to transfer your technicals skills into sourcing, evaluating, and executing high-impact deals
• Your strategic mindset allows you to identify opportunities that align with our business objectives and technical vision


Benefits

France

💰 Competitive cash salary and equity
🥕 Daily lunch vouchers : Swile meal vouchers with 10,83€ per worked day, incl 60% offered by company
🥎 Sport : Enjoy discounted access to gyms and fitness studios through our Wellpass partnership
🚴 Transportation : Monthly contribution to a mobility pass via Betterway
🧑‍⚕️ Health : Full health insurance for you and your family
🍼 Parental : Generous parental leave policy
🌎 Visa sponsorship
🤝 Coaching: we offer BetterUp coaching on a voluntary basis
We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.
Apply for this job
